Detailed Description

Definition at line 187 of file lustre_log.h.

Field Documentation

int(* llog_operations::lop_close)(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *handle)

Close llog file and calls llog_free_handle() implicitly.

Any opened llog must be closed by llog_close() call.

int(* llog_operations::lop_declare_add)(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *lgh, struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, struct thandle *th)

Add new record in llog catalog.

Does the same as llog_write_rec() but using llog catalog.

int(* llog_operations::lop_declare_create)(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *handle, struct thandle *th)

Create new llog file.

The llog must be opened. Must be used only for local llog operations.

int(* llog_operations::lop_declare_write_rec)(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *lgh, struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, int idx, struct thandle *th)

write new record in llog.

It appends records usually but can edit existing records too.

int(* llog_operations::lop_open)(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *lgh, struct llog_logid *logid, char *name, enum llog_open_param)

Any llog file must be opened first using llog_open().

Llog can be opened by name, logid or without both, in last case the new logid will be generated.
